subject: p10046166
Findings: Frontal and lateral views of the chest were obtained. Rounded calcified nodule in the region of the posterior right lung base is seen and represents calcified granuloma on CTs dating back to, likely secondary to prior granulomatous disease. Previously seen pretracheal lymph node conglomerate and right hilar lymph nodes are better seen/evaluated on CT. No focal consolidation is seen. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Cardiac and mediastinal silhouettes are stable with possible slight decrease in right paratracheal prominence.
Impression: No radiographic findings to suggest pneumonia.
